subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Monday, May 07, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker

Poll: Clinton gets significant boost over
Obama

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. Hillary
Clinton, D-New York, has increased her lead over the Democratic
field in the race for the presidential nomination, according to
a new CNN/Opinion Research Corporation Poll released Monday
afternoon.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/poll-clinton-gets-significant-boost.html

***

House Dems tackle new Iraq bill

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- House Democratic leaders are preparing
a new version of the Iraq war funding bill that would pay for
the war in two stages. 

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/house-dems-tackle-new-iraq-bill.html

***

Poll: Giuliani, McCain lead the pack

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- A year and a half before the 2008
presidential election, Rudy Giuliani and Sen. John McCain are
leading the Republican pack, according to a CNN/Opinion
Research Corporation Poll out Monday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/poll-giuliani-mccain-lead-pack.html

***

Poll: Bush approval stands at 38%

WASHINGTON, DC (CNN) President Bush has a 38% approval
rating in our new CNN-Opinion Research Corporation poll. That's
two points higher than when we last asked the question last
month. 61 % of those questioned in our new poll say they
disapprove of the way Mr. Bush is handling his job. The two
point rise in the approval rating is within the polls three
point margin of error. 

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/poll-bush-approval-stands-at-38.html

***

Queen Elizabeth in Washington: Poll finds U.S.
loves her, Bush slips up

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
The queen is loved, not only in Britain but in that nation's
former North American colony.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/queen-elizabeth-in-washington-poll.html

***

White House prepares a 'royal dinner'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- A feast fit for royalty awaits Queen
Elizabeth II and Prince Philip Monday night, as President Bush
and first lady Laura Bush break bread with America's strongest
allies.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/white-house-prepares-royal-dinner.html

***

Justice Dept. clears the way for Goodling immunity,
congressional testimony

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
The Justice Department on Monday cleared the way for its former
liaison to the White House, Monica Goodling, to be granted
immunity and to testify before a congressional committee
investigating the controversial firing of several U.S.
attorneys. 

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/justice-dept-clears-way-for-goodling.html

***

Clinton refuses to cede 'home turf'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Even though Sen. Barack Obama
represents the Windy City back here in the nation's capital,
Sen. Hillary Clinton made it clear Monday that she will fight
for every vote in her birth state when it comes to the
Democratic presidential nomination.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/clinton-refuses-to-cede-home-turf.html

***

McCain names new political director

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Mike Dennehy, a New Hampshire political
operative credited with helping Sen. John McCain win the 2000
Granite State GOP presidential primary, is stepping down as
national political director of the Arizona senator's 2008
campaign.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/mccain-names-new-political-director.html

***

Poll: Most Americans expect gas prices to
reach $4 per gallon this year

WASHINGTON
(CNN) -- More than three in four Americans think it is likely
that gas prices will hit $4 per gallon this year, and nearly
half of them consider it very likely to happen, a poll said
Monday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/poll-most-americans-expect-gas-prices.html

***

Obama sees similarities with the Chicago
Bulls

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Sen. Barack Obama,
D-Illinois, told a Detroit audience Monday he sees similarities
between himself and the Chicago Bulls, during a speech he
delivered on the future of the U.S. auto industry in the Motor
City.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/obama-sees-similarities-with-chicago.html

***

Bill Clinton pens NY Times' crossword
puzzle

NEW YORK(Reuters) -- Former U.S.
President Bill Clinton has a new pastime far from fund raising
for worthy causes -- designing a crossword puzzle for The New
York Times.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/bill-clinton-pens-ny-times-crossword.html

***

Obama: U.S. auto industry must look to
fuel-efficient vehicles as foreign rivals have done

DETROIT (AP) -- Democratic presidential candidate
Barack Obama on Monday faulted U.S. automakers for failing to
do what foreign manufacturers have accomplished in producing
fuel-efficient vehicles.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/obama-us-auto-industry-must-look-to.html

***

Judge names Lewinsky attorney to defend
alleged 'DC Madam'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The
judge in the criminal trial of a woman accused of running a
large-scale prostitution ring around Washington has appointed
an attorney who helped represent Monica Lewinsky in the
impeachment proceedings against President Clinton.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/judge-names-lewinsky-attorney-to-defend.html

***

It's back to work for recuperating Gov.
Corzine

PRINCETON, New Jersey (AP) -- Jon S.
Corzine resumed his duties as governor Monday, nearly a month
after a high-speed crash on the Garden State Parkway almost
killed him.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/its-back-to-work-for-recuperating-gov.html
